lines.text: Please tell us, did the defendant have a personal hatred toward the plaintiff?
Yes he did. He told me, "I feel so much hatred toward the plaintiff, that I can't even eat"
But the defendant claims he never knew Papishvili before!

[Looks at Valiko who shakes his head negatively]
Why would he know him from before? When we first walked in, Valiko told me, "Listen" he said, "Who is this defendant, where did he go, I" he told me, "see him for the first time ever"
So, you're telling us that the defendant did not hurt the plaintiff?
Of course he didn't. When that guy locked himself up in the bathroom, Valiko could not break the door.
So he did try to break the door?

[Scared that he said something he shouldn't have]
Why would he?
Didn't you just say so yourself?

[Becomes very nervous and begins to sweat]
Listen, I don't speak Russian that well. When he locked himself up in the bathroom, Valiko knocked on the door and said that he has to go too. You're asking such questions that I don't feel comfortable answering them.
The truck got stolen.
What do you mean stolen? Are you sure this is where you parked it?
What do you mean am I sure? A woman was smoking next to that garbage bin over there.
Rubik stay here, don't let anyone go in or out, get the trails. I'll go get the police.
Tell them that the truck got stolen, it was brand new!
Givi Ivanovich, that policeman has no respect for you whatsoever! He took away both, the car and the license.
How much is coffee?
Eleven.
What about tea?
Six.
I want some tea please. Keep the change.
Look, I'll tell you a clever thing, just don't take offence.
I want Larisa Ivanovna!
What's your surname?
What do you care?
Mizandari?
Mizandari.
